title: [BUG] ForecastingGridSearchCV does not return error_score
body:
**Describe the bug**

ForecastingGridSearchCV does not return error_score as nan, it returns the error itself and stops searching further.

        error_score: numeric value or the str 'raise', optional (default=np.nan)
                The test score returned when a forecaster fails to be fitted.
            return_train_score: bool, optional (default=False)

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
        import random
        y = []
        for i in range(0,50):
            n = random.randint(-30,30)
            y.append(n)
        
        ets = {"trend" : ["multiplicative"],
               "seasonal":["multiplicative"],
               "sp":[3,6]}
        
        
        cv = ExpandingWindowSplitter(initial_window =18, start_with_window=True, fh=[1,2,3])
        
        forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing()
        
        gscv = ForecastingGridSearchCV(forecaster=forecaster,
                                        param_grid=ets,
                                        cv=cv, verbose = 1, n_jobs = -1)
        
        gscv.fit(np.array(y))
```
        ValueError: endog must be strictly positive when usingmultiplicative trend or seasonal components.

I have on purpose used negative values and multiplicative seasonal/trend components for Exponential Smoothing



**Expected behavior**

Return nan as values for parameters where fit has failed and scores where fit was implemented.
